definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: On the whole, average weekly hours are far below their pre-recession level.
sentences.chinese: 整體而言，周平均工作時間比起衰退前大幅下滑。

sentences.english: Pure cotton grey fabric prices fell modestly, trading volume is still insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 純棉坯布價格小幅下滑，成交量仍顯不足。

sentences.english: At the same time, maybe coincidentally, Pakistan's cricketing powers have been in decline.
sentences.chinese: 同時，巴基斯坦板球實力一直處於下滑中。

sentences.english: Then the price of oil began a nearly two-decade slide.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，石油價格開始了近二十年的下滑。

sentences.english: After a couple of brief growth spurts, home prices have started declining again in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 經過幾次短暫的增長，房價又實實在在地開始下滑。

sentences.english: One is the reason why trade slumped so badly at the turn of the year.
sentences.chinese: 一是就是貿易爲何在今年底或明年初如此嚴重地下滑。

sentences.english: Automatically tricking water slides downwards along a filler to a pond, which eliminates the water falling sound and the drift ice phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 自淋水沿填料下滑至水池，消除了落水聲和漂水現象。

sentences.english: Rock climbers descend the spire of Tricouni Nail in the Needles of South Dakota Black Hills.
sentences.chinese: 南達科他州黑崗石林裏，攀巖者從三齒釘山尖下滑。

sentences.english: Nail in the Needles of South Dakota Black Hills.
sentences.chinese: 南達科他州黑崗石林裏，攀巖者從三齒釘山尖下滑。

sentences.english: The waist buttocks use the flexible connection, in raises in the process the patient not easy to glide down.
sentences.chinese: 腰臀部採用軟連接，在升起的過程中病人不易下滑。

sentences.english: The composite index stopped the declining momentum, gaining 28 points to 671.
sentences.chinese: 綜合指數停止下滑，上升28點，達到671點。

sentences.english: The drop in retailers indicates they got ahead of themselves. There’s de-risking.
sentences.chinese: 零售業下滑預示了未來，風險很大。

sentences.english: GDP has lurched sickeningly downward, but employment has not.
sentences.chinese: 國內生產總值急劇下滑，但就業率還算大致穩定。

sentences.english: His grades started dropping. He hated being in a group.
sentences.chinese: 他的成績開始下滑，討厭團體活動，總是形單影隻。

sentences.english: However, in the playoffs, their winning percentage has fallen precipitously .
sentences.chinese: 可是，到了季後賽，他們的勝率卻突然下滑。

sentences.english: The glut of shipping capacity has forced down rates.
sentences.chinese: 航運量的供過於求已經造成了利率下滑。

definition: to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
(of the weather) to warm up again
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
